column4: would anybody know why when i disable my onboard video and plugin my nvidia pci card my wireless connection just WONT connect ?
disabling onboard video = BIOS settings, not OS issue
i know that but.. why is it that when my pci card is in, ndiswrapper/wlan0 wont connect ?
it could be shared IRQ, check motherboard manual + lspci
in lspci it doesnt look like a shared irq
it won't show up if its a shared IRQ conflict, all it does is it shows what hardware has it detected on PCI slots
so if they both show up in lspci then thats not the problem?
what else could be the problem?
again, you may need to consult with the motherboard manual + those PCI cards that are conlicting manuals?
if i put the card in a different pci slot would that help?
possibly, you may be able to get your motherboard manual online, go look for your motherboard's manufacturer's website and they should provide you one unless if yours is really outdated
if i did get the manual, what would i be looking for?
the motherboard manual will show you a table of which PCI IRQ slots are shared
so you have tried a couple of different PCI slots and yet it still fails to detect?
i really have no clue whats going on :( when i use onboard video, i can use ndiswrapper/get online fine...but when i disable onboard video and put in my nvidia pci card.... cant connect

what about the manual? you might want to try reading to see if you can find out which is shared. That problem is kinda odd, but because your video card is PCI, and so is your wireless card, its definetly an IRQ conflict
